narcissistic personality disorder: a pervasive pattern of grandiosity in fantasy or behavior need for admiration and lack of empathy beginning by early adulthood and present in a variety of contexts as indicated by five or more of the following 1 has a grandiose sense of selfimportance eg exaggerates achievements and talents expects to be recognized as superior without commensurate achievements 2 is preoccupied with fantasies of unlimited success power brilliance beauty or ideal love 3 believes that he or she is special and unique and can only be understood by or should associate with other special or highstatus people or institutions 4 requires excessive admiration 5 has a sense of entitlement ie unreasonable expectations of especially favorable treatment or automatic compliance with his or her expectations
